isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - TOP COVER ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: TOP COVER ASSEMBLY

note.para: Four different top cover assemblies are available (Figure 23):

item.para: Standard position top cover with a standard shift pattern.
Standard position top cover with an "X" shift pattern.
Forward position top cover with a standard shift pattern.
Forward position top cover with an "X" shift pattern.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Four Different Top Cover Assemblies

svcproc.para: Standard position top covers have the detent balls and springs under the shift lever housing.
Forward position covers have the detent balls and springs under a plate behind the shift lever housing.
Top covers with an "X" shift pattern have a stud and a nut that fasten the rocking lever assembly to the top cover.

step1.para: Shift the transmission to the NEUTRAL position.

note.para: If a heavy-duty detent spring is used, the spring (different color) is in the bore on the slave valve side of the transmission.

step1.para: Remove the three detent springs from the holes in the top cover (Figure 24).
Use a magnet to remove a detent ball from each of the three holes (Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove Detent Springs and Ball

step1.para: Remove the mounting bolts and washers from the top cover.

caution.para: Use a rubber mallet or "dead blow" hammer to separate the top cover from the transmission case. Do not use pry bars or screwdrivers to separate the cover from the case. Pry bars or screwdrivers may damage the cover and case mounting surfaces. If the cover is still difficult to remove, remove the slave valve and the interlock pin from the main case.

step1.para: Remove the top cover from the transmission case (Figure 25).
Use a scraper to remove the sealant material from the top cover and the transmission case.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Top cover From Transmission
